title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy within 90 days of certification by the President of the Senate. A special election to fill a Senate vacancy must be held within 90 days of certification by the President of the Senate, in accordance with state laws governing special elections. This rule does not apply if the vacancy occurs near the date of a regularly scheduled election. The subsection specifies that a special election to fill a Senate vacancy must adhere to state laws. An exception is made if the vacancy occurs close to a regularly scheduled election, in which case the rule does not apply. The certification for filling a Senate vacancy must be issued within 90 days before a general election or before the first session of the next Congress after the election. This section does not affect a state's authority to temporarily appoint a Senator. The section specifies that a Senate vacancy must be filled within 90 days before a general election or the first session of the next Congress. It does not impact a state's ability to temporarily appoint a Senator. SEC. 297 of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 provides payments to states to reimburse a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Commission will make payments to eligible States to cover costs for special elections to fill Senate vacancies under the Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act. States must submit a statement of incurred or anticipated costs to receive payment. States eligible for payment under the Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act must submit a statement of costs for special elections to fill Senate vacancies to the Commission. The Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act requires states to submit a statement of costs for special elections to the Commission. The payment made to a state will be 50 percent of the reasonable costs incurred in holding the special election. The Commission will make a payment to a State equal to 50 percent of the reasonable costs incurred for holding a special election, to be paid within 30 days of receiving the State's cost statement. No payment will be made unless the State agrees to repay any overpayments. The Commission will pay a State within 30 days of receiving their cost statement for holding a special election. The State must agree to repay any overpayments exceeding the actual election costs incurred. Authorization of appropriations for payments under the Help America Vote Act of 2002 for special elections to fill Senate vacancies.
